• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.

violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.

achieved.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth nutrition
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4149
Section (3) A resident who has been prescribed a special diet by a
Description physician shall be provided such a diet.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Every two hours Youth A is supposed to have a syringe of water in
their feeding tube. Youth A did not get breakfast and was taken to
rehab by facility staff. Staff at the rehab did not feed Youth A and
Youth A appeared malnourished.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
06/10/2024.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 06/10/2024 and
reported no additional information. The syringe of water is to flush
the tube before starting the liquid meal.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on
06/10/2024. FCW reported she visits with Youth A monthly and
did not have any concerns prior to this complaint.
Youth A was observed at the facility on 06/11/2024. Youth A is
non-verbal and could not be interviewed. Youth A has cerebral
palsy and requires 1:1 care and supervision. Youth A was
observed sitting in his wheelchair. He appeared to be clean, neat,
and smiled and engaged.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 06/11/2024. Staff 1 has
been working at the facility for six months. Staff 1 reported on
06/06/2024 she was assigned to be Youth A’s 1:1. She started her
shift at 8:00am and took over for Staff 2. She was informed by
Staff 3 that Youth A had refused to eat breakfast, so he was
provided with his liquid meal by Staff 2. She said Staff 2 had
flushed Youth A’s feeding tube before feeding him. Staff 1 packed
Youth A’s breakfast and lunch and transported Youth A to the
rehab center at 9:15am for physical and speech therapy. Staff 1
continued to supervise Youth A at therapy. She said Youth A ate
his breakfast at 10:45am and she transported Youth A to school at
11:30am.
2

Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 06/11/2024. Staff 2 is the
midnight staff assigned to Youth A on 06/06/2024. Staff 2 reported
Youth A sometimes refuses to eat his breakfast and when he does
not eat his breakfast staff provide him a cart of his liquid meal
through his feeding tube. She said on 06/06/2024 she attempted
to feed Youth A oatmeal at 7:00am and he would not eat it, so she
flushed his feeding tube and provided him a cart of his liquid meal.
She said staff do follow Youth A’s meal plan and on average
Youth A gets two liquid meals per day, it also depends on if Youth
A does not like the meal that is being served.
Director was interviewed via telephone on 06/11/2024. Director
reported she spoke with Staff 2 and was informed on 06/06/2024
Staff 2 attempted to feed Youth A at 7:00am but he refused to eat,
so she gave him his liquid meal through his tube. She is not aware
of any incidents of Youth A’s feeding tube not being flushed. She
said Staff 3 had also attempted to feed Youth A at 8:00am but he
refused. Staff 1 transported Youth A to rehab at 9:00am and was
with Youth A until he was dropped off at school at 11:30am. Youth
A was examined by the nurse today and the nurse did not express
any concerns regarding Youth A’s weight or health.
Nurse was interviewed via telephone on 06/24/2024. Nurse
reported Youth A is examined bi-weekly and she has no concerns
for his weight and health. She said on 06/11/2024 Youth A was
examined, and he observed to be clean, neat, and happy. She did
not have any concerns regarding his weight.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 07/16/2024. Staff 3
reported she has been working at the facility for three years. She
recalled working with Staff 2 on 06/06/2024 supervising Youth A.
She said she started her shift at 8:00am and watched Youth A
until 9:00am. She said Staff 1 took over at 9:00am. Staff 3
attempted to feed Youth A around 8:00am, but he refused to eat
his breakfast. She packed Youth A his breakfast and lunch and
provided them to Staff 1.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s MARs report: 1:1 Supervision, Medical condition
traumatic cerebral edema with loss of consciousness
greater than 24 hours. Cerebral palsy, symptomatic
epilepsy and epileptic syndromes with complex partial
seizures. Youth A’s diet plan: purees texture, no liquids by
mouth, and provide bolus feeding if needed.
3

• Youth A’s feeding logs (which logs liquid meals only) on
06/06/2024: Youth A was provided a liquid meal at 7:57am
and 8:31pm.
• Health Care Appraisal for Youth A dated 06/11/2024
completed by Nurse. Exam normal, weight 64 lbs., clean,
well kept, and smiling.
• Supervision Policy: 1:1 Supervision, a single staff member
is exclusively assigned to a single client. The client must be
within arm’s reach at all times. The staff member cannot be
utilized to supervise other clients or assigned other duties.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted there is insufficient evidence that
Youth A is not being fed or is malnourished. Staff interviewed and
documentation provided confirmed Youth A was provided a liquid
meal when he does not eat his breakfast, as indicated in his diet
plan.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Personal hygiene
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4148
Section (1) An institution shall assure that each resident maintains or
Description receives personal care, hygiene, and grooming appropriate to the
resident’s age, sex, race, cultural background, and health needs.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Facility staff transported Youth A from rehab to school without
ensuring the youth was changed.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 06/10/2024 and
reported no additional information.
Staff 1 reported she was assigned to Youth A on 06/06/2024 and
transported Youth A to rehab at 9:00am. Staff 1 was with Youth A
at the rehab from 9:00am till 11:30am and admitted she did not
check or change Youth A’s briefs before transporting him to
school. Youth A’s teachers provide care once Youth A has arrived
at school.
Staff 2 reported she was assigned to Youth A on 06/06/2024 from
12:00am (midnight) to 8:00am. She checked Youth A’s briefs
every two hours. Staff 2 said Youth A’s briefs are supposed to be
checked every two hours or when he needs to be changed.
4

Director reported staff are required to check Youth A’s brief every
two hours and on 06/06/2024, Staff 1 confirmed she did not check
Youth A’s brief’s before dropping him off at school.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’ s Bladder documentation log.
Task: Brief checks every two hours. Log dated
06/06/2024: Youth A was checked at 2:00am, 4:00am,
6:00am, and 8:00am at the facility. Youth A was with Staff 1
at the rehab from 9:00am to 11:30am and there were no
documented log checks during this time.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted this violation is established. Staff 1
admitted she did not check or change Youth A’s briefs before
transporting him to school.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: The investigation concerned allegations that a youth with significant medical needs was not fed according to his prescribed diet and was transported to school in soiled briefs. While the malnutrition allegation was not substantiated, investigators established a violation for personal hygiene because a staff member admitted to failing to check or change the youth's briefs before transport, breaching the facility's care plan. The facility's administration bears culpability for this lapse in supervised care, as it indicates a failure in staff training or protocol adherence for a youth requiring 1:1 supervision.
